text: Your mind is like this water, my friend. When it is agitated, it becomes difficult to see. But if you allow it to settle, the answer becomes clear.
author: Bil Keane

text: A little consideration, a little thought for others, makes all the difference.
author: A.A. Milne

text: A man with a watch knows what time it is. A man with two watches is never sure.
author: Segal’s Law

text: We judge others by their behavior. We judge ourselves by our intentions.
author: Ian Percy

text: It pays to plan ahead. It wasn’t raining when Noah built the ark.
author: Howard Ruff

text: Someone’s sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
author: Warren Buffet

text: When you combine ignorance and leverage, you get some pretty interesting results.
author: Warren Buffet

text: No matter how great the talent or efforts, some things just take time. You can’t produce a baby in one month by getting nine women pregnant.
author: Warren Buffet

text: We don’t have to be smarter than the rest, we have to be more disciplined than the rest.
author: Warren Buffet

text: It takes twenty years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that you’ll do things differently.
author: Warren Buffet

text: Should you find yourself in a chronically leaking boat, energy devoted to changing vessels is likely to be more productive than energy devoted to patching leaks.
author: Warren Buffet

text: You only have to do a very few things right in your life so long as you don’t do too many things wrong.
author: Warren Buffet

text: You never know who’s swimming naked until the tide goes out.
author: Warren Buffet

text: Never ask a barber if you need a haircut.
author: Warren Buffet

text: There seems to be some perverse human characteristic that likes to make easy things difficult.
author: Warren Buffet

text: Finance is not merely about making money. It’s about achieving our deep goals and protecting the fruits of our labor. It’s about stewardship and, therefore, about achieving the good society.
author: Robert J. Shiller

text: One of the funny things about the stock market is that every time one person buys, another sells, and both think they are astute.
author: William Feather

text: If you’ve been playing poker for half an hour and you still don’t know who the patsy is, you’re the patsy.
author: Warren Buffet

text: Learning to love is hard and we pay dearly for it. It takes hard work and a long apprenticeship, for it is not just for a moment that we must learn to love, but forever.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

text: Above all, don’t lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

text: A man always has two reasons for what he does — a good one, and the real one.
author: J.P. Morgan

text: People speak sometimes about the “bestial” cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

text: Too many people spend money they haven’t earned, to buy things they don’t want, to impress people that they don’t like.
author: Will Rogers

text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: The first step towards getting somewhere is to decide that you are not going to stay where you are.
author: J.P. Morgan

text: Go as far as you can see; when you get there, you’ll be able to see farther.
author: J.P. Morgan

text: A man’s worth is no greater than the worth of his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: Sex without love is as hollow and ridiculous as love without sex.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: A man sees what he wants to see and disregards the rest.
author: Paul Simon

text: A bad day is when I lie in the bed and I think of things that might have been.
author: Paul Simon

text: The human race is unimportant. It is the self that must not be betrayed.
author: John Fowles

text: The most important questions in life can never be answered by anyone except oneself.
author: John Fowles

text: We make our world significant by the courage of our questions and by the depth of our answers.
author: Carl Sagan

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: To play a wrong note is insignificant; to play without passion is inexcusable.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: Do not merely practice your art, but force your way into its secrets; it deserves that, for only art and science can exalt man to divinity.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: The world is a king, and like a king, desires flattery in return for favor; but true art is selfish and perverse — it will not submit to the mold of flattery.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: The oldest, truest, most beautiful organ of music, the origin to which alone our music owes its being, is the human voice.
author: Richard Wagner

text: A fellow of mediocre talent will remain a mediocrity, whether he travels or not; but one of superior talent will go to seed if he always remains in the same place.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

text: I never lie down at night without reflecting that — young as I am — I may not live to see another day.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

text: Be silent, if you choose; but when it is necessary, speak — and speak in such a way that people will remember it.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

text: If I could only impress on the soul of every friend of music, how inimitable are Mozart’s works, how profound, how musically intelligent, how extraordinarily sensitive!
author: Joseph Haydn

text: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
author: William Shakespeare (Victor Hugo)

text: It was music, more than anything else, that led the Pythagoreans to believe that the universe is a harmonious place governed by numbers.
author: Ian Stewart

text: Music is a world within itself, with a language we all understand.
author: Stevie Wonder

text: The conscious utterance of thought, by speech or action, to any end, is art.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: He is but a poor philosopher who holds a view so narrow as to exclude forms not to his personal taste.
author: John Galsworthy
